testcase.name: fetchOptions() returns object with three properties: start, end, and amount
fetchOptions() return value has correct start, end, and amount values
fetchOptions() doesn't hard code the start, end, and amount values
addPriceToPage() returns the parameter without the dollar sign
addPriceToPage() adds the parameter minus the '$' to the 'endPrice' input when passed '$765.01'
addPriceToPage() adds the parameter minus the '$' to the 'endPrice' input when passed '$435.53'
priceFor() accepts two parameters: the first is an options object
priceFor() accepts two parameters: the second is a callback function
priceFor() calls on the callback function in getJSON's 'done'
priceFor() formats the ajax call properly with country, start, end, amount, and format
fetchEndPrice() passes the return of fetchOptions() as the first param to priceFor()
fetchEndPrice() gives the callback it's passed as a parameter as the second params to priceFor()
fetchEndPrice() adds the adjusted price to '#endPrice' for two dates in 2012 and $100
fetchEndPrice() adds the adjusted price to '#endPrice' for one date in 2009, one in 2012, and $200
